metadata.title: CVE-2020-12421 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
When performing add-on updates, certificate chains terminating in non-built-in-roots were rejected (even if they were legitimately added by an administrator.) This could have caused add-ons to become out-of-date silently without notification to the user. This vulnerability affects Firefox ESR < 68.10, Firefox < 78, and Thunderbird < 68.10.0.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2020-12421` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-geckodriver - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
firefox-mozsymbols - 78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '78.0.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:68.10.0+build1-0ubuntu1').
